content: Horsegram, also known as kulthi or kulith, is a type of legume that is high in protein and has a nutty, slightly sweet flavor. It is a good source of nutrients, including protein, fiber, and various minerals such as iron, zinc, and potassium. Horsegram is also relatively low in carbohydrates, with a serving size of 100 grams providing approximately 20 grams of carbs. Horsegram is commonly used in Indian and Southeast Asian cuisine, where it is often used to make soups, stews, and curries. It can also be sprouted and used in salads or as a garnish. Horsegram is considered a nutritious food that can be a valuable part of a healthy diet.
